name: Berlin New Year's Run
description: Just as the old (sports) year ends, the new one begins: with a running event. The New Year's run at the Brandenburg Gate attracts about 3,500 runners annually.

name: Ultraschall Berlin: Festival for New Music
description: The Ultraschall festival for new music will once again take place in various locations in Berlin in 2026.

name: International Green Week Berlin
description: The International Green Week in Berlin is considered the world's biggest public fair for the food, agricultural, and horticultural industries.

name: Days of Dance Berlin
description: Days of Dance (Tanztage) is a contemporary dance festival focusing on the discovery and support of up-and-coming choreographers and dancers based in Berlin.

name: CTM Festival
description: The CTM Festival for Adventurous Music and Art celebrates experimental, contemporary and electronic music in special places of Berlin's nightlife.

name: SixDay Berlin
description: At the six day race in the Velodrom, professional and amateur racing cyclists compete with each other at breathtaking speed.

name: Ice Skating Rinks in Berlin
description: Ice skating is the perfect way to spend a cold winter's day in Berlin. Grab your skates and head to one of the capital's ice rinks.

name: Sledding Hills in Berlin
description: As soon as the first snow falls, many families are drawn to the sledding hills in Berlin's parks and forests. Discover the city's best sled runs.

name: Winter in Berlin
description: Spend your winter in Berlin: Dates and events in the colder months, addresses for winter sports, indoor activities and more tips.

name: Berlin Short Film Festival
description: Any genre and any format allowed: The Berlin Short Film Festival aims to connect filmmakers from all over Europe.

name: Silent Film Festival
description: At the annual silent film festival, classics of silent cinema come to the big screen in Berlin accompanied by a live orchestra.

name: Unknown Pleasures
description: In 2026, the Unknown Pleasures festival will present a diverse selection of the best and most exciting independent films for the 16th time.

name: British Shorts
description: The British Shorts film festival celebrates the funniest, strangest and most exciting short films from Great Britain and Ireland.

name: Indian Film Festival 2025
description: The Indian Film Festival presents the diversity and creativity of Indian cinema in a series of impressive screenings.

name: JuBi Berlin
description: The youth education fair JuBi provides information about student exchanges, language trips, au pairs and internships abroad.

name: European Camera Trade Show Berlin
description: At this international camera trade show, dealers and collectors offer cameras and other photography products for sale or exchange.

name: Hippologica Berlin
description: Hippologica Berlin is the largest equestrian event in Berlin with a sales fair, horse shows and educational programs.

name: Joseph Beuys: Collection Presentation
description: The Hamburger Bahnhof in Berlin presents the extensive collection of works by the artist Joseph Beuys in the Kleihueshalle.

name: Toyin Ojih Odutola: U22 – Adijatu Straße
description: Hamburger Bahnhof presents figurative drawings by Toyin Ojih Odutola that interplay between history and representation.

name: Dinosaurs! Age of the Giant Lizards
description: The new special exhibition "Dinosaurs!" lets you discover dinosaurs from the three geological eras - Triassic, Jurassic and Cretaceous - for the first time. The atar of the exhibition is Berlin's very own T-Rex "Tristan Otto".

name: The Second Glance: All Forms of Love
description: A cooperation of Berlin's Gay Museum and the Bode Museum, "All Forms of Love" casts a second look on works in the Bode collection that deal with the diversity of sexual identities and LGBTIQ life in art from previous eras.

name: Ancient Egypt
description: The Egyptian Museum and Papyrus Collection has a chance to present itself on a scale never shown until now, with over 2 500 exhibits on display in the Neues Museum's northern wing over three floors, covering 3600m².

name: Delcy Morelos: Madre
description: Delcy Morelos' first solo exhibition in Germany presents a new, expansive installation at the Hamburger Bahnhof that explores the themes of the earth, indigenous knowledge, regeneration and the connection between nature and humanity.

name: Berlin Global
description: Yesterday, today, tomorrow: much of what happens in Berlin has an impact on the world. And much of what happens in the world has an impact on Berlin.

name: All Hands On: Basketry
description: Basketry is a cultural technique that is thousands of years old, practised worldwide, regionally distinctive and still a handicraft in the truest sense of the word.

name: Endless Exhibition
description: More than 15 installations, sculptures and interventions have been set up in and around the Hamburger Bahnhof since it opened as a museum of contemporary art in 1996.

name: The Second Glance: Women
description: “Women” is the second integrated exhibition in the series The Second Glance, and was produced in collaboration with the organisation Frauentreff Olga, a drop-in and counselling centre for drug-using women, trans women, and sex workers.

name: Berlin's Districts
description: Information on residential areas, infrastructure, events, local authorities and leisure activities.

name: Attractions & Sights
description: Berlin’s top attractions, palaces and monuments with address, photos, public transport details and

name: Exhibitions in Berlin
description: See the best museum, art and photography exhibitions at Berlin's top museums, galleries and event venues.

name: Flea Markets
description: Berlin's most popular flea markets and antique markets with adresses, opening hours, public transport and map.

name: One Billion Rising
description: The movement "One Billion Rising" aims to bring women and men together in public places to dance against violence against women and for respect for all.

name: Berlin Independent Film Festival
description: The Berlin Independent Film Festival champions low-budget filmmaking in Europe by giving new directors the opportunity to screen their work and swap ideas.

name: Berlinale - Berlin International Film Festival
description: The Berlin International Film Festival, Berlinale for short, is one of the most important film festivals worldwide. Every year, it attracts the elite of the film industry as well as the largest audience of any film festival in the world.

name: Biennale of the Berlin Philharmonic Orchestra
description: The motto of the 2025 Berlin Philharmonic Biennale was "Paradise lost? - On the threat to nature" and focused on the dangers of climate change and species extinction.

name: Tanzolymp - International Dance Festival
description: Berlin as an international meeting place for cultures - this is the basic idea behind the international dance festival Tanzolymp.

name: Transmediale
description: Transmediale is a festival and year-round project in Berlin that highlights new connections between art, culture and technology.

name: Japanmarkt Berlin
description: The Japanmarkt at Festsaal Kreuzberg is all about Japanese design, culture, art, music and food.

name: Schall & Rausch
description: The Neukölln Schall & Rausch Festival aims to shake up Berlin's musical theater scene.

name: Berlin Fashion Week 2025
description: Twice a year, the international fashion scene gathers in Berlin for Berlin Fashion Week.

name: Eat Berlin
description: At the gourmet food festival Eat Berlin, over 100 top chefs from Berlin, Germany and around the world showcase their skills.

name: Berlin Valentine's Run
description: The Valentine's Run in the Gardens of the World is a relatively new addition to Berlin's running calendar.

name: Weinmesse Berlin Wine Fair
description: Around 270 exhibitors from all over the world are presenting wines, wine literature and delicatessen at the Messe Berlin.

name: Liebe ist
description: At this fair, couples will find ideas and service providers on the subject of weddings as well as the latest wedding trends.

name: Fruit Logistica
description: Fruit Logistica is an international trade fair for fruit and vegetable marketing.

name: Travel Weather: Berlin in February
description: Best museum weather: The average weather in Berlin in February is a rather grey matter.

name: River Cruises
description: Boat trips in Berlin on Spree river, on Landwehr canal or over the Wannsee.

name: MaerzMusik
description: MaerzMusik is a music festival that combines the diverse currents within contemporary music into a panorama rich in contrasts with renowned artists from all over the world.

name: European Month of Photography
description: Every other year, more than 100 museums and galleries in Berlin present photographic art at the largest photo festival in Germany, the European Month of Photography.

name: European Arts and Crafts Days
description: Artisans and designers present their work and open their studios for workshops, fashion shows and lectures.

name: Forecast Festival
description: The Forecast Festival at Radialsystem presents the results of the transdisciplinary, international mentoring program "Forecast".

name: Festtage at the Berlin State Opera
description: The Festival Days at the Berlin State Opera present great music each year around the Easter holidays.

name: Berlin Chocolate Festival
description: This two-day food festival immerses visitors of all ages in the world of chocolate and cocoa.

name: Klavierfest Weißensee
description: This year, the piano festival in Berlin-Weißsensee is dedicated to none other than the composer Johann Sebastian Bach.

name: Spring Festival at Kurt-Schumacher-Damm
description: Amusements rides, lots of entertainment for children and culinary delights are welcoming visitors at the funfair near Tegel Airport.

name: Run Around the Müggelturm
description: The run around the Müggelturm ushers in the firsts signs of spring in Berlin and attracts many runners with its beautiful route in the midst of nature.

name: Greek Film Festival
description: The Greek Film Festival wants to bring often still unknown Greek filmmakers into the focus of the German audience.

name: Final Girls Berlin
description: Where, if not in Berlin, does a feminist, queer and non-binary horror film festival belong? The Final Girls film festival promises dark and daring entertainment.

name: Women's Day in Berlin
description: International Women's Day on March 8 is a public holiday in Berlin. Tips for an entertaining and eventful Women's Day in the capital.

name: Spring in Berlin
description: Flea markets, spring festivals, beer gardens, open-air events and more: the best tips for beautiful spring days in Berlin.

name: ITB Berlin - International Travel Trade Show
description: The ITB is the world's leading travel trade show and provides a unique opportunity to learn about different countries and regions all over the globe in one place.

name: Transform
description: For two days, the Transform will be all about how digital visions can be turned into reality.

name: Savoir Vivre Wine Fair
description: Inside the Great Orangery at Charlottenburg Palace, visitors can sample wines, sparkling wines and fine spirits from more than 20 vintners and merchants.

name: Staudenmarkt: Berlin Perennial Market
description: At the Berlin perennial plant market in autumn, visitors can stock up on plants.

name: Tree Blossom Festival: Britzer Baumblüte
description: The traditional Britzer Baumblüte is a warm spring awakening under blossoming trees. For the 70th time, the folk festival invites you to the festival grounds next to the green Gutspark Britz.

name: Spring Festival Marzahn-Hellersdorf
description: The Marzahn-Hellersdorf Spring Festival promises fun and entertainment for the whole family - with rides, play attractions and culinary highlights.

name: Medieval Fair: Easter Knight Spectaculum
description: A historical market, knights tournaments and a fire show on horseback await visitors at the Spandau Citadel.

name: Cherry Blossom Festival in the Gardens of the World
description: Celebrate "Hanami" in Berlin: the Gardens of the World in Marzahn welcome the long-awaited spring with countless pale pink cherry blossoms and an exciting cultural program.

name: Easter Festival in Friedenau
description: At Easter, Schmiljanstrasse in Friedenau is transformed into a lively festival mile. For three days, there will be live music, market stalls and activities for children and families.

name: Easter
description: From carnivals and Easter markets to Easter egg hunts: Here are the best events on Easter 2026 in Berlin.

name: Cherry Blossoms in Berlin
description: Every spring a sea of pink cherry blossoms blooms in Berlin for a few days. Discover the places where you can admire the cherry blossoms and feel as if you were in Japan.

name: Berlin Half Marathon
description: The Berlin Half Marathon is the season opener for runners, walkers, inline skaters, wheelchair users and hand cyclists.

name: Wartenberg Easter Run
description: The traditional Easter run of Wartenberger SV offers four distances: A half marathon, a scenic 12.3 kilometer landscape run, a 4.1 kilometer run and a children's run.

name: Run through Volkspark Friedrichshain
description: Runners can choose between three routes of different lengths, which lead over the hilly terrain of the park.

name: Sehsüchte
description: Sehsüchte student film festival: In 2026, the Sehsüchte festival will take place in Potsdam-Babelsberg for the 55th time.

name: Alfilm - Arabic Film Festival
description: The festival "Alfilm" presents the best and newest films from the Arab world.

name: 11 mm - International Football Film Festival
description: The festival shows over 60 international feature, documentary and short film productions on the theme of football.

name: Beachfood Festival
description: The Beachfood Festival at the Wendenschloss lido brings beach vibes and international delicacies to Berlin-Köpenick.

name: Naschmarkt International
description: At the Naschmarkt in Markthalle Neun in Kreuzberg, Berlin confectioners offer international sweet treats such as cakes, cookies and chocolates.

name: Asian Streetfood Festival
description: The diversity of Asian culture unfolds at the Asian Streetfood Festival on the RAW site.

name: Berlin Comic Book Fair
description: The Berlin Comic Book Fair (Berliner Comicmesse) is a meeting place for fans, publishers and illustrators of graphic literature. Both classic comic books and new releases are present at the visitors' fair.

name: Paper Positions
description: The (Half)marathon Expo is held biannually in spring and fall as a complementary trade show to the Berlin Half Marathon and the Berlin Marathon. This is where the race number distribution for the races takes place.

name: International Cannabis Business Conference
description: At the International Cannabis Business Conference, experts from the fields of medicine, business, politics and law will meet to exchange views on the latest developments regarding medical cannabis in Germany.

name: Gallery Weekend Berlin
description: The Gallery Weekend Berlin is one of the leading events for contemporary art in Germany and invites visitors to take a tour of Berlin's creative scene.

name: International Museum Day
description: Since 1992, International Museum Day has been accompanied by an annually changing motto and is held under the patronage of the President of the Federal Council.

name: Berliner Theatertreffen
description: The Berliner Theatertreffen ("Berlin Theatre Encounter") is the most important theatre festival in Germany, reuniting actors, theatre professionals, journalists and guests from all over the world in Berlin.

name: Berlin Design Week
description: Design as a driving force for social and ecological change: Every spring, designers, artists, companies and universities present new ways of thinking and fresh ideas at the Berlin Design Week.

name: Re:publica
description: At the Internet conference, players from the Internet community, science, politics and culture exchange views on current issues in the digital society.

name: DFB Cup Final in Berlin
description: The DFB Cup final is the soccer highlight of the year at Berlin's Olympic Stadium. All important information on the DFB Cup Final 2025.

name: XJazz Festival Berlin
description: With 80 acts, XJazz is Berlin's largest jazz festival and aims to cross stylistic boundaries with innovative artists.

name: Pictoplasma Berlin
description: Pictoplasma Berlin is a festival about figure design in art and graphics and offers lectures, exhibitions and film screenings.

name: Comic Invasion
description: Berlin's largest comic festival takes place every year. With many free events, the Comic Invasion 2026 invites you for the 15th time.

name: May Day in Berlin
description: Street festivals, parties and concerts: May Day in Berlin is an exciting day. The German Labor Day is celebrated all over the city with events for the whole family.

name: May 08: Day of Liberation
description: Events and memorial sites in Berlin to commemorate the Day of Liberation from National Socialism and the end of the Second World War.

name: Father's Day in Berlin
description: In the Christian faith, Ascension Day marks the return of Jesus Christ as the Son of God to his Father in heaven. In many places, including in Berlin, Ascension Day is also celebrated as Father's Day or Men's Day.

name: Beer Gardens
description: In the spring and summer months, Berliners are drawn to one of the many beer gardens.

name: Outdoor Swimming Pools
description: Whether you're in Wedding, Mariendorf, Neukölln or Charlottenburg, Berlin's public outdoor pools provide refreshment and fun in the summer heat. An overview of outdoor swimming pools in Berlin with addresses, directions and ticket information.

name: Steglitzer Woche
description: Every year in spring, the folk festival Steglitzer Woche invites visitors to enjoy themselves in the green Bäkepark.

name: Spring Festival at the Schöneweide Railroad Depot
description: At the spring festival at the Schöneweide railroad depot, children and adults can check out locomotives from the inside and take a ride on an old steam train.

name: Festival for Democracy and Tolerance
description: The Treptow-Köpenick Alliance for Democracy and Tolerance invites Berliners and visitors to its 22nd annual folk festival for democracy.

name: Biesdorf Blossom Festival
description: Between blooming flowers and historic walls, the Biesdorf Blossom Festival invites you to a weekend full of music, art and culinary delights.

name: Spring Festival at Späth'sche Baumschulen
description: More than 100 exhibitors invite visitors and plant lovers to the spring festival at the Späth'sche Baumschulen tree nurseries in Treptow-Köpenick.

name: Spring and Asparagus Festival Primavera
description: In mid-May, the spring festival "Primavera" takes place in Berlin's Schöneberg district. Asparagus dishes and other delicacies as well as a colorful stage program await the visitors.

name: S 25 Berlin
description: Once to the Olympic Stadium and back: more than 10,000 runners take part in Germany's oldest city run every year.

name: Women's Run Berlin
description: The Women's Run is an annual highlight of the Berlin running calendar.

name: Berlin Triathlon
description: The Berlin Triathlon will take place for the 20th time in 2026. It starts at the Island of Youth in Treptower Park in Berlin.

name: VeloBerlin
description: At the public trade fair for bicycles, new urban mobility and travel, exhibitors will present current bicycle models, e-bikes, city and trekking bikes and racing bikes.

name: Gartenträume Berlin
description: This visitor fair presents current products and trends from the gardening and plant sector. Garden lovers can get tips on plant care at workshops and lectures.

name: Fête de la Musique
description: Every year on June 21, Berliners celebrate the beginning of summer with an open-air music festival. At the Fête de la Musique, musicians and bands play live music in the streets of Berlin for free.

name: Carnival of Cultures
description: Berlin presents its most colourful side: At the Carnival of Cultures, numerous groups of diverse nationalities present music, dances, performances, visual arts and acrobatics at a parade of moving floats.

name: Long Night of the Sciences
description: On the "smartest night of the year", numerous scientific institutions and laboratories open their doors and invite visitors to participate.

name: Staatsoper für alle
description: The open-air concert of the Staatskapelle Berlin conducted by Christian Thielemann is a cultural highlight for fans of classical music. The concert is open to everyone free of charge.

name: Bicycle Rally of the ADFC
description: As part of the Sternfahrt bike rally, thousands of cyclists will gather and advocate for better cycling conditions in Berlin.

name: Berlin Book Festival
description: Berlin's Bebelplatz will be transformed into a huge open-air bookstore with an extensive stage program for the Berlin Book Festival.

name: 48 Hours Neukölln
description: Within 48 hours, about 300 cultural institutions and societies display the diversity of Neukölln's artistic potential at the arts and culture festival.

name: Kreuzberg Festival
description: The Kreuzberg Festival, formerly Bergmannstraßenfest, can look back on a rich history. On three summer days a year, the neighborhood has been celebrating the peaceful coexistence of all generations since 1994.

name: Berlin Biennale
description: Held every other year, the Berlin Biennale turns various locations in the city into galleries for contemporary art.

name: Street Food Fest on Teufelsberg
description: Midsummer on Teufelsberg: If you want to enjoy the longest day of the year with delicacies from all over the world in a relaxed Berlin summer atmosphere, the Teufelsberg is the place to be.

name: Architecture Days in Berlin
description: On the last weekend in June, the Berlin Chamber of Architects invites Berliners and visitors to discover the building culture of the capital.

name: Berlin Jazz Week
description: With around 30 concerts over seven days, Berlin will once again be transformed into the jazz capital this June.

name: Open Days at Hamburger Bahnhof
description: The Hamburger Bahnhof is celebrating its third Open Days with a free enterteinment program.

name: Köpenick Summer Festival
description: Summer in Köpenick will be colorful: Visitors can look forward to a diverse music and entertainment program on the Köepnick Palace island.

name: Spandau Havelfest
description: Three days, two stages, a dozen live music acts as well as amusement rides and other attractions will delight visitors of the Spandauer Havelfest.

name: Pankow Art Festival
description: The annual Pankow Art Festival takes place on the grounds of Schönhausen Palace. Visitors can experience live music and acrobatics, and purchase handmade arts and crafts from over 60 artists.

name: Berlin Tennis Open
description: The international elite of women's tennis returns to Berlin. The Berlin Tennis Open presented by ecotrans Group will be held at the LTTC Rot-Weiß.

name: Dokumentale
description: The Dokumentale presents an exciting selection of documentary films, media projects, VR experiences and readings.

name: Zebra Poetry Film Festival
description: Since 2002, the Zebra Poetry Film Festival has presented the current state of a dynamic short film genre between poetry, film and new media.

name: Xposed Queer Film Festival
description: This international film festival showcases current and classic queer films that show the development of queer life.

name: Rico Puhlmann: Fashion Photography 50s–90s
description: Rico Puhlmann was one of the most internationally renowned fashion photographers of his time, heavily influencing our image of fashion in his era.

name: Vamos a la playa: Holidays Under Franco
description: To mark the 50th anniversary of Francisco Franco’s death, the MEK will show seven artistic approaches to dealing with the role of mass tourism in Spain during the dictatorship.

name: Pentecost in Berlin
description: Tips and events for the Pentecost holidays 2025 in the German capital.

name: Summer in Berlin
description: Parks, lakes, open-air events, beach bars, beer gardens and festivals: To enjoy summer to the fullest, life in Berlin takes place outside during the warmer months.

name: Mary Jane Berlin
description: At the international cannabis fair, more than 270 exhibitors will present the many different applications of the useful plant.

name: Affordable Art Fair
description: Visitors can see and buy contemporary works of art at the Affordable Art Fair.

name: Sticks & Stones
description: At this LGBTIQ job fair, visitors can meet potential employers, make business contacts and attend talks about the career world.

name: Christopher Street Day 2025
description: On Christopher Street Day, hundreds of thousands of people take to the streets to fight for the rights of LGBTQ+ people with a great parade, colourful floats and lots of music.

name: Rave the Planet
description: After the end of the original Love Parade in the capital, its founder Dr. Motte is bringing the successor Rave the Planet back to Berlin.

name: Open Days at the Berlin University of the Arts
description: Every summer at the end of the academic year, Berlin's University of the Arts opens its workshops, studios and rehearsal rooms to the public for three days.

name: Lollapalooza Festival
description: The US festival Lollapalooza is coming to Berlin for the tenth time in 2025. With music, art, food and much more, it attracts thousands of visitors every year.

name: Berlin E-Prix: Formula E Race in Berlin
description: The race of the all-electric motorsport series Formula E will take place at the former Tempelhof Airport in Berlin again in 2025.

name: Lesbian and Gay City Festival
description: The Lesbian and Gay City Festival in Berlin is Europe's largest street festival of its kind. It takes place around Nollendorfplatz, the traditional gay stomping ground in Schöneberg.

name: Classic Open Air on Gendarmenmarkt
description: For a few days every summer, Gendarmenmarkt in the heart of Berlin is transformed into a concert stage for the finest classical music concerts.

name: 25 years of C/O Berlin
description: The exhibition space for photography and visual media C/O Berlin is celebrating its 25th birthday with a special anniversary program.

name: Britzer Garden Night
description: This year, the Britzer Garten once again invites you to a magical night full of artistry, music and light shows.

name: Adidas Runners City Night
description: The City Night is a summer night run for skaters and runners in Berlin's western center.

name: BG Summer Festival: 50 years Berlinische Galerie
description: As the highlight of the festival, the Berlinische Galerie invites you to the big BG Summer Festival.

name: Bridge Festival in Schöneweide
description: Music, open-air cinema, an arts and crafts flea market, theater performances and exhibitions: At the Bridge Festival, the district of Schöneweide shows its diverse cultural offerings.

name: International Barrel Organ Festival
description: Around 130 barrel organ players from various countries will entertain visitors with their instruments.

name: Tegel Harbor Festival
description: The Harbor Festival in Alt-Tegel delights visitors with live music, numerous amusement rides and a lively atmosphere.

name: Rummel auf der Bucht
description: Culture by the water in the heart of the city! In Rummelsburger Bucht, concerts, workshops, talks and readings invite you to enjoy a varied summer day by the lake.

name: Berliner Volksfestsommer
description: The largest folk festival in Berlin, formerly the German-French Fair, attracts visitors with amusement rides and culinary delicacies.

name: Symbiotic Wood
description: The exhibition offers a fascinating journey through the world of wood, a more-than-human material that plays an important role for humans and for many other species.

name: Bite Club
description: The Bite Club street food market at Arena Berlin invites you to feast and celebrate with international delicacies, cool drinks and good music.

name: Kosher Street Food Festival
description: At the Jewish Community of Berlin's Kosher Street Food Festival, hungry visitors can sample sabich, falafel, Tel Aviv bowls and more.

name: True Italian Pizza Street Festival
description: This two-day food festival brings together Berlin pizzerias to celebrate what is arguably the most popular Italian dish.

name: Lakes for Swimming
description: Berlin has many beautiful swimming lakes where visitors and locals like to cool off on hot summer days. Discover Berlin's most popular lakes and lidos.

name: Droidcon
description: Android experts meet at droidcon Berlin to further develop the operating system and build a strong network.

name: Terraristikbörse Berlin
description: At the Terraristikbörse (Terraristics Exchange) Berlin, reptile lovers can purchase lizards, snakes and spiders and gain information about the species-appropriate keeping of the animals.

name: Long Night of Museums
description: During the Long Night of Museums in Berlin, many museums and exhibition venues in the capital will once again open their doors at night.

name: Open Day of the German Federal Government
description: For one weekend per year, the Federal Chancellery, the Press and Information Office and the Federal Ministries invite all citizens to take a look behind the scenes of political Berlin.

name: Dance in August
description: Dance in August is one of the most important festivals of contemporary dance and the largest gathering of dance theater in Europe.

name: Zug der Liebe
description: The central aim of the "Zug der Liebe" demonstration is to protest for more compassion, charity and social commitment. A total of 15 trucks will be at the start.

name: LGBT Park Festival
description: The LGBT Park Festival (LesBiSchwules Parkfest) on the grounds of the open-air cinema in Volkspark Friedrichshain will take place for the 26th time in 2025.

name: Pop-Kultur
description: Pop-Kultur is a three-day festivals that turns Berlin's Kulturbrauerei into a hub of popular music with concerts, lectures and talks.

name: Berlin Circus Festival
description: The Berlin Circus Festival on Tempelhofer Feld celebrates the diversity of contemporary circus.

name: Night of Shooting Stars
description: During the natural spectacle of the Perseid meteor shower in mid-August, up to 100 shooting stars per hour can be seen in the sky.

name: Young Euro Classic
description: Youth symphony orchestras from all over the world enrich the Berlin summer with classical music concerts at the Konzerthaus Berlin on Gendarmenmarkt.

name: Schollenfest
description: The Schollenfest in Berlin-Tegel offers family fun for young and old visitors amid the residential area "Freie Scholle".

name: Kenako Africa Festival
description: The Kenako Festival takes place each year on Berlin's Alexanderplatz. A traditional marketplace with tents and a live stage program offers visitors a taste of Africa.

name: Nikolaizauber
description: This festival of cabaret in the historical Nikolaiviertel neighborhood offers a colorful entertainment program for families on two days.

name: Gatow Airfield Festival
description: Every year on Reservists' Day, the Military History Museum of the German Armed Forces in Gatow invites visitors to the Airfield Festival.

name: Folk Festival in Altstadt Spandau
description: The former Spandau Wine Summer returns to the historic center of the district under the name Spandauer Altstadtfest.

name: Klára Hosnedlová: Embrace
description: Klára Hosnedlová presents a monumental installation that revolves around home, utopias and everyday life in different political systems in the historic hall.

name: Fujiko Nakaya: Fog Sculpture in the Sculpture Garden
description: Nakaya's fog sculptures transcend the traditional boundaries of sculpture by creating temporary and limitless transformations that engage the audience and give the atmosphere a malleable form.

name: Takehito Koganezawa: One on Two, Two from One
description: Takehito Koganezawa (b. 1974 Tokyo, Japan) is an artist who makes drawings, videos, installations and performances.

name: British Shorts Summer Edition
description: In the Summer Edition, the British Shorts Festival presents selected highlights from this year's short film program.

name: Box Office Around the World
description: In the open air, the Humboldt Forum presents films from all over the world on three weekends in summer.

name: UFA Film Nights
description: The UFA Filmnächte (UFA Film Nights) honor the film avant-garde of the 1920s. The films are shown open air in front of a spectacular backdrop on Museum Island and accompanied by live music.

name: Pistachio Street Food Festival
description: The Pistachio Street Food Festival is dedicated to the green kernels, which can be found in both sweet and sour dishes from all over the world.

name: German Rum Festival
description: The German Rum Festival is one of the largest fairs in the field of rum, rhum and cachaca worldwide.

name: Culture & Entertainment
description: From musicals and show to theatre plays and concerts: Discover the cultural life and entertainment offers in Berlin.

name: Musikfest Berlin
description: The Musikfest, which emerged from the traditional Berliner Festwochen, is Berlin's largest festival for orchestral music.

name: IFA Berlin - Consumer Electronics Fair
description: At the IFA, more than 2000 exhibitors present the latest developments in consumer electronics and home appliances. Visitors can take a look at brand new devices long before they hit the shelves.

name: Berlin Art Week
description: The Berlin Art Week is a great opportunity for art enthusiasts to discover and discuss the works of international and local artists exhibited in hundreds of galleries.

name: Positions Berlin Art Fair
description: The Positions Berlin Art Fair takes place in Hangars of the former Tempelhof Airport. Here, new as well as established contemporary works are presented next to works of classical modernism.

name: Open Heritage Day
description: At the Open Heritage Day, also known as Open Monument Day, numerous monuments which are usually closed to the public open their doors for visitors.

name: Citizens' festival in the grounds of Schloss Bellevue
description: Celebrating with the Federal President: In September, the citizens' festival takes place at the official residence of Federal President Steinmeier in Berlin.

name: International Literature Festival
description: In September, Berlin becomes the capital of literature. Around 200 authors from over 40 countries are expected at the International Literature Festival

name: Days of Jewish Culture
description: In 2025, the Days of Jewish Culture will once again offer a feast for the senses and present modern Jewish culture through music, cinema and literature.

name: Festival of Giant Kites
description: At the Festival of Giant Kites in Berlin, unique kites up to 40 meters long will provide a flying spectacle above Tempelhofer Feld.

name: Open Day at the Berlin Animal Shelter
description: Visitors of the open day day at the Berlin animal shelter in Falkenberg can look forward to discussion rounds, market stalls, join-in activities and lots more.

name: Bülow Street Festival
description: The Bülowstraße invites you to the neighborhood festival! The program has it all and combines music, art, workshops, city discoveries and more.

name: Open Studios in the Gerichtshöfe Wedding
description: Visitors can wander through the six listed courtyards on their own during the Open Studios.

name: Festival at the Mäusebunker
description: For ten days, the area around the Mäusebunker is transformed into a multifaceted festival site where people discuss, play, learn, cook and make things.

name: Open Day at the Berlin State Opera
description: The Staatsoper Unter den Linden invites you to a varied afternoon of dance, music and anecdotes.

name: Berlin Autumn Carnival
description: High Sky, Anubis and more: Expect lots of fun rides at the Berlin Autumn Carvival on the fairground at Kurt-Schumacher-Damm.

name: Railway Festival at the Schöneweide Depot
description: The railway festival invites all locomotive fans to get to know the Schöneweide railway depot.

name: Lake Festival at the Orankesee Lido
description: The festival at Orankesee Lake presents an entertaining mix of music, circus arts, acrobatics, magic and street theater.

name: Harvest Festival in Hellersdorf
description: The Hellersdorf Harvest Festival welcomes visitors with an entertaining stage program, foods and drinks as well as a colorful lantern parade.

name: Moabiter Kiezfest
description: The Kiez festival in Moabit invites visitors to get to know and celebrate the colorful diversity of the neighborhood around Turmstraße.

name: FilmPolska
description: FilmPolska in Berlin is the biggest festival of Polish cinema abroad and shows the most exciting Polish productions of the past year.

name: Silent Film Festival: Stummfilm Live
description: Under the motto "100 Years of Silent Film!" the Babylon Cinema is showing films that celebrate their 100th anniversary this year.

name: Fantasy Filmfest
description: The Fantasy Filmfest presents horror movies, fantasy films and thrillers, some of them as European and world premieres.

name: BMW Berlin Marathon
description: At the end of September, the German capital hosts one of the biggest running events in the world: the Berlin Marathon.

name: ISTAF - International Stadium Festival
description: World class athletes from various disciplines make the International Stadium Festival (ISTAF) at the Berlin Olympic Stadium one of the world's most popular sporting events.

name: Berlinman Triathlon
description: Swim in the Wannsee, cycle on the Havelchaussee and run in the Grunewald forest. In addition to the sprint and middle distance, there is also a mini-marathon.

name: Berlin Chili Fest
description: At the Berlin Chili Fest at Berliner Berg Brauerei everything revolves around the hot pepper and craft beer.

name: Potato Festival in Dahlem
description: A celebration for potato fans: This year, too, a special festival is dedicated to the multifaceted earth tuber.

name: Historical Apple Festival at Britz Palace
description: With historical music, a fruit exhibition, artistic performances and fun activities, the festival at Britz Palace celebrates Germany's most popular garden fruit - the apple.

name: Pumpkin and Apple Festival in Britzer Garten
description: The Britzer Garten is once again hosting the Pumpkin Festival this year, where giant pumpkins and large straw figures will be on display.

name: Food Festival Berlin
description: The Food Festival Berlin, which is taking place for the fourth time this year, is helping to raise the international profile of Berlin's food culture.

name: Berlin Ramen Festival
description: At the Berlin Ramen Festival, everything revolves around the internationally popular noodle soup and other traditional Japanese dishes.

name: Green World Tour
description: At the Green World Tour public fair, the focus is on sustainability in all areas of life.

name: Tattoo Convention Berlin
description: Fans of body art from all over the world meet at the Tattoo Convention in Berlin. National and international artists of the tattoo scene show their skills with the needle.

name: InnoTrans
description: Technology companies will present their latest products and innovations at the international trade and visitor fair for transport technology.

name: Open Mosque Day
description: Every year on October 03, the Islamic religious communities in Germany organize the nationwide Open Mosque Day.

name: Berlin Food Week
description: The Berlin Food Week offers professional chefs, home cooks and foodies a platform for enjoyment and exchange.

name: Müggelsee Half Marathon
description: The Müggelsee Half Marathon leads runners clockwise around the Müggelsee lake in the southeast of Berlin.

name: Festival of Lights
description: Once a year, Berlin’s world famous sights and monuments in the city centre become the canvas for spectacular light and video projections at the Festival of Lights.

name: Jazz in the Minister Gardens
description: Every autumn, modern jazz soundscapes rise from the historic grounds of the Ministergärten (Minister Gardens) and become a musical experience of a special kind.

name: Tag der Clubkultur
description: The Tag der Clubkultur (Day of Club Culture) takes place annually in October and makes the diversity of Berlin's clubbing and nightlife scene visible.

name: Day of Germany Unity in Berlin
description: On October 03, 2025, Berlin and Germany will celebrate 35 years of reunification. Discover the most important events, exhibitions, activities and other highlights for the Day of German Unity.

name: Autumn in Berlin
description: Autumn walks, relaxed movie nights, kite flying and captivating theater evenings make it easier to say goodbye to the outdoor pool and heat.

name: Medieval Juggler Festival at Spandau Citadel
description: The Gauklerfest (Juggler Festival) takes place at the impressive Spandau Citadel built during the Renaissance. Visitors can look forward to a wonderful program with medieval flair.

name: Schöneberg Pumpkin Festival
description: On the first weekend of October, a Pumpkin Festival takes place on Akazienstraße and Belziger Straße in Schöneberg.

name: Autumn Market at Domäne Dahlem
description: Colorful foliage, fresh air and golden light: autumn has arrived in Berlin! The outdoor museum Domäne Dahlem is celebrating the season with market selling fabrics and handmade objects.

name: Harvest Festival in Spandau
description: The Hahneberg Nature Conservation Station organizes a colorful harvest festival at the beginning of October.

name: Hauptstadtwiesn at Spinner-Brücke
description: With Paulaner beer and a band playing traditional folk music, the Oktoberfest celebration "Hauptstadtwiesn" brings Bavarian atmosphere to Berlin.

name: Bar Convent Berlin
description: At the international trade fair of the bar and beverage industry, exhibitors present new and exciting products and trends from the cocktain and beverage scene.

name: Wedding Bells
description: At the Wedding Bells fair, couples will find everything they need to make their personal wedding dream come true.

name: Punkfilmfest
description: Under the motto «Too Drunk to Watch», the Punkfilmfest shows movies dealing with the punk subculture, anarchy and rebellion.

name: FrauenWelten
description: The "FrauenWelten" film festival at the Kulturbrauerei shows over 30 films about women who fight for human rights, self-determination and against violence.

name: Film Restored - Film Heritage Festival
description: The Film Heritage Festival shows films from bygone eras that, thanks to extensive restoration work, can be seen again, and presents restored lost films from different countries to the public for the first time ever.

name: Bazaar Berlin
description: Manufacturers and traders from 60 countries present their crafts, designs and natural products at this international sales fair.

name: Zeit für Zirkus - Nuit du Cirque
description: "Zeit für Zirkus" (Time for Circus) is the nationwide format of the European "Nuit du Cirque". For three days, everything in Berlin revolves around contemporary circus.

name: Jazzfest Berlin
description: Integrated into the Berliner Festspiele, the Jazzfest Berlin is the crowning finale of every jazz year. Over four days, there is a varied program for all jazz lovers.

name: Zeughausmesse
description: The Zeughausmesse is one of the leading fairs for applied contemporary art. It provides artists and designers with the opportunity to present and sell their work to design connoisseurs.

name: Día de los Muertos at Holzmarkt
description: The Holzmarkt celebrates Día de los Muertos with an altar, cultural program, Mexican delicacies and a fiesta.

name: Berlin Science Week
description: With more than 200 events, the Berlin Science Week aims to bring Berlin as a science location into the public spotlight.

name: Theater der Dinge
description: At the international festival of contemporary puppet and object theater, artists from all over Europe present a wide range of theater projects in shows, performances and exhibitions.

name: Events on November 09
description: Commemorative events for the proclamation of the German Republic, the Hitler Putsch, Pogrom Night or the fall of the Berlin Wall.

name: Christmas Garden Berlin
description: For Christmas Garden, the Botanical Garden in Berlin is transformed into a glowing fairytale landscape with all kinds of light shows, magic forests and 3D illuminated figures.

name: Christmas at the Tierpark
description: Europe's largest zoo will be bathed in Christmas lights again this year. The historical Friedrichsfelde Palace is at the heart of the luminous Christmas tour.

name: International Short Film Festival Berlin
description: Every year in autumn, the International Short Film Festival attracts cinephiles from all over the world to Berlin. The festival presents about 400 films from over 120 countries.

name: French Film Week
description: The Film Week brings the best of French cinema to the capital. The crème de la crème of contemporary French filmmakers will present their works in Berlin.

name: Italian Film Festival
description: Subtle humor, joie de vivre and sometimes blunt realism: The Italian Film Festival brings Italian cinema to Berlin.

name: Nan Goldin: This Will Not End Well
description: Stories about love, intimacy, addiction and loss: the exhibition "This Will Not End Well" at the Neue Nationalgalerie presents a retrospective of the extraordinary photographer and filmmaker Nan Goldin.

name: After Images
description: The group exhibition “After Images” at JSF Berlin proposes a recalibration of our relationship to contemporary image culture.

name: Games Ground
description: Games Ground is a trade fair for gaming professionals and a festival for the gaming community in equal measure.

name: AngelWelt Berlin - Fishing Show
description: At the AngelWelt public fair, companies from the fishing industry present current products and trends. Sport and recreational anglers can practice fishing techniques.

name: Boat & Fun
description: At the boat show for motorboats and sailing yachts, visitors can check out the latest motorboats, sailboats, houseboats, pontoons and diving equipment.

name: LGBTIQA Winterdays and Christmas Avenue
description: At the LGBTQIA Winterdays and the Christmas market on Nollendorfplatz, atmospheric lighting, a varied stage program and high-quality delicacies await visitors.

name: Medieval Christmas Market at the RAW Compound
description: This Christmas market in Friedrichshain presents itself in all its historical splendour.

name: Christmas Fair on Landsberger Allee
description: The "Lichtenberger Winterzeit" Christmas fair attracts numerous guests to Lichtenberg with mulled wine and a funfair atmosphere.

name: Christmas in Berlin
description: Christmas markets,Christmas tours, festive illuminations and more: the most important information for the holiday season in the capital.

name: New Year's Eve Party at the Brandenburg Gate
description: Music, stars and entertainment: With a huge open-air party at the Brandenburg Gate, Berlin rings in the new year.

name: Louis Lewandowski Festival
description: The Louis Lewandowski Festival is a choir festival dedicated to the music of Jewish composers who emigrated from Germany. It is named after the German-Jewish composer of the same name.

name: Winterzauber in the Gardens of the World
description: During the Advent season, the Gardens of the World shine in Christmas splendor and invite you to the first Winterzauber.

name: Berlin New Year's Eve Run
description: Before the big New Year's Eve party, runners can end the old year in a sporty way at the traditional Berlin New Year's Eve Run organized by the SCC Berlin.

name: Events on New Year's Eve
description: Shows, parties, classical concerts: There are many ways to celebrate the turn of the year in Berlin. Here are the best event tips for New Year's Eve 2025.

name: Search for Christmas Markets
description: Which Christmas market takes place today, tomorrow, next weekend? With the Christmas market search you can find out when over 60 Christmas markets are open in Berlin.

name: Winter City Tour across the Spree River
description: Even in winter, the Spree River is inviting you to take a steamboat trip through the center of Berlin. Aboard the passenger ship, visitors can relax and discover Berlin in winter.

name: Christmas lights tour
description: Enjoy the festive decorations of Berlin on a Christmas city tour.

name: Christmas Market Tour
description: Discover Berlin's most beautiful Christmas markets with a local tour guide and learn about German Christmas traditions and their historical origins.

name: Christmas Film Festival
description: The first festival that is all about Christmas is taking place at the Moviemento cinema in Kreuzberg.

name: Doc.Berlin
description: The documentary film festival Doc.Berlin invites fans of informative cinema to four days of movies at the Babylon cinema.

name: Christmas Market on Gendarmenmarkt
description: Located on one of the most beautiful squares in Berlin, this Christmas Market offers quality decorations, food and entertainment.

name: Christmas Market in Alt-Rixdorf
description: Cobblestones, warm light from oil lamps and a historical backdrop: The Alt-Rixdorf Christmas market on Richardplatz attracts visitors with its unique ambience and charitable commitment.

name: British Christmas Market
description: Under the motto "A Very British Christmas", the congregation of St George's Church in Charlottenburg organizes a cozy Christmas market every year.

name: Raw Wine Berlin
description: At this public wine fair at Markthalle Neun in Kreuzberg, organic winemakers from all over the world present their wines.

name: Made in Berlin Job Fair
description: The job and career fair "Made in Berlin" is aimed at university graduates who are looking for an internship or the right career start.
